meanings.definition: The act of transferring something to someone else.
meanings.sent1: She completed the handovers of the documents to her colleague.
meanings.sent2: The handovers of the keys to the new owner were done smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The handovers of the cookies to the hungry children brought smiles all around.
meanings.sent4: The handovers of knowledge from the teacher to the students opened new doors of understanding.
meanings.sent5: The handovers of the crown symbolized the transfer of power to the new ruler.

meanings.definition: The process of relinquishing control or responsibility to another person or group.
meanings.sent1: The handovers of the project management duties were well planned.
meanings.sent2: During the handovers of authority, clear communication is crucial.
meanings.sent3: The handovers of the remote control during family movie night always lead to arguments.
meanings.sent4: Her handovers of decision-making power made her team feel empowered.
meanings.sent5: The handovers of leadership in the company marked a new era of change.
